meanings.definition: A force that pushes something upwards.
meanings.sent1: The upthrust of the balloon made it float in the air.
meanings.sent2: The upthrust of the rocket propelled it into space.
meanings.sent3: The upthrust of the helium balloon surprised the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The upthrust of the elevator took us to the top floor in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The upthrust of the hot air balloon against gravity was a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: With a sudden upthrust, the gymnast completed her flip.
meanings.sent2: The upthrust of the diver from the board was graceful.
meanings.sent3: The upthrust of the cat trying to catch a bird was comical.
meanings.sent4: The upthrust of the fountain water reached impressive heights.
meanings.sent5: The upthrust of the tree branches in the wind was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To push or lift something upwards.
meanings.sent1: She used all her strength to upthrust the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter upthrust the barbell above his head with ease.
meanings.sent3: He upthrust the kite into the sky, watching it soar.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind upthrust the leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter upthrust the child to safety from the burning building.
